title: Gym Body:'What's Your Excuse?' Says Guy Sharing Pic Of A 58YO Ripped Man & People Are Making Some Out Of The World Excuses It
text:
One of the biggest workout motivations is to see people above the age of 50 maintaining an absolutely perfect form and being consistent with it.

Take celebrity fitness expert Milind Soman for example, he might be 53 years, but it seems like age never caught up with him, all because of his regular running and exercise regime.

With the intention to share the much needed workout motivation, this Twitter user shared a jaw-dropping picture of 58-year-old ripped man named Jaswinder Singh.

His comment read. 'What's your excuse?' and that's about it, it took a few minutes for the Internet's troll army to churn out some absolutely unrelated excuses.

Don't Miss 106 SHARES 26.4 K SHARES 12.4 K SHARES 30.7 K SHARES 2.8 K SHARES

From saying, 'I don't wear a turban,' to 'I don't have a beard' people made the wildest exuses possible and it also points to the reality when it comes to working out.

Take a look at the excuses below:

#1

I am not 58 yet......... — Nitin (@Nitin01252081) October 24, 2019

#2

Ek baar gym join kia tha.

2 dinn gaya uske baad 7 dinn tak pain killer k bharosa zinda raha😭😭😂 — Narendra Phekendra Modi Ji (@GodiMediaKaPapa) October 24, 2019

#3

Agle monday se pakka 🤣 — Upendra C. Gokhale (@upendracgokhale) October 25, 2019

#4

I don't wear a turban😂 — Mr.Pasha (@27Iamabhinav) October 24, 2019

#5

Phone is distraction. — Deepanshu (@Dhakkchampion) October 24, 2019

#6

I'm not jobless. — Procrastinator (@sagar_ravrane17) October 24, 2019

#7

Working out past three months. Seeing changes inside me and outside too. Life disciplined si ho gayi hai. Last sem 54% se this sem 94% attendence. — Vishal Sharma (@__init__main) October 24, 2019

#8

Desk job. — Simeon Panev (@s_panev) October 25, 2019

#9

Paise nahin hain — Raj (@Brat_R_P) October 25, 2019

#10

Paise nahin hain — Raj (@Brat_R_P) October 25, 2019

There are a million reasons we can find to skip exercise and the comments on this picture holds testimony to that!

Jokes apart, if gyming is not your cup of tea, there are a hundred others things you can do.

You might have to put that extra effort to carve out a mere hour out of your busy schedule, be it in the morning or evening.

In that one hour, you can run, walk, do yoga or follow YouTube for fitness tutorials. It may seem absolutely pointless in the beginning, but consistency is key and yes, throw excuses out the window.
description: One of the biggest workout motivations is to see people above the age of 50 maintaining an absolutely perfect form and being consistent with it. Take celebrity fitness expert, Milind Soman for example, he might be 53 years, but seems like age never caught up with, all because of his regular running and exercise regime.
